result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Albino Granda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Miguel Albino Granda is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Miguel Albino Granda was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Effective upon reinstate of driving privileges

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. (Bond applied)

timeConds.notes: Report today to get start date and be served within 60 days. 1/2 on electronic monitor if qualifies according to the jail rules.

4:00 p.m. Defendant Miguel Albino Granda in court with attorney Elisabeth Fletcher. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria is given the oath of Interpreter and interprets for the Defendant & Court.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Count 1 Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle (.18% reading): W/H Sentence and Probation for 3 yrs, 9 mo jail, $600 + costs, 36 mo Revocation and 36 mo IID. Cts 2, 4, 6, and 8 to be dismissed. Cts 3, 5, and 7 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State complied with victim notification statutes.
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Cts 2, 4, 6, and 8 are dismissed. Cts 3, 5, and 7 are Dismissed and Read In.
State makes sentencing recommendation statements.
Atty Fletcher concurs.  Credit 53 days.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:****Probation
Ct 1: W/H Sentence: Probation for 3 yrs
Conditions:
9 mo jail with huber, 53 days credit. Report today to get start date and be served within 60 days. 1/2 on electronic monitor if qualifies according to the jail rules.
$600 + costs + DNA surcharge 
36 mo Revocation 
36 mo IID, effective upon reinstate driving privileges

  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
